meanings.definition: To evolve into a new species.
meanings.sent1: Birds on the isolated island began to speciate over time.
meanings.sent2: The fish population in the lake started to speciate due to environmental changes.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that if humans lived on Mars, they would speciate into a different species.
meanings.sent4: The idea of robots evolving to speciate like living organisms is fascinating.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the magical creatures were able to speciate into various forms at will.

meanings.definition: To cause to evolve into a new species.
meanings.sent1: The environmental changes speciate the insects living in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The introduction of a new predator can speciate the prey population.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy decided to speciate the flowers in the garden for fun.
meanings.sent4: The alien technology had the power to speciate any living organism it touched.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell accidentally caused the potion to speciate into a rainbow of colors.
